title: Cramer's Rule Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of Cramer's rule for solving linear systems.

questions.question: What is Cramer's rule used for?
questions.explanation: Cramer's rule solves systems of linear equations using determinants.

questions.question: In Cramer's rule, xᵢ = det(Aᵢ) / det(A). What is Aᵢ?
options: A with column i replaced by the constant vector
A with row i replaced by the constant vector
questions.explanation: Aᵢ is A with its i-th column replaced by the constant vector B.

questions.question: When can Cramer's rule NOT be used?
questions.explanation: Cramer's rule requires det(A) ≠ 0 (invertible coefficient matrix).

questions.question: What is the computational complexity of Cramer's rule for n×n systems?
questions.explanation: Cramer's rule requires computing n+1 determinants of size n×n, each O(n!).

questions.question: Cramer's rule gives the same solution as which method?
options: Both Gauss elimination and matrix inverse method
questions.explanation: Cramer's rule, Gauss elimination, and matrix inverse all give the same solution.
